content: Prof. Zheng Zhang's Homepage Biography Publications Professional Activities Team Zheng Zhang Professor, Doctoral Supervisor Cheung Kong Young Scholar (教育部青年长江学者) Harbin Institute of Technology, Shenzhen, China [Google Scholar] [Homepage in Chinese] Area Chair: ICML/NeurIPS/ICLR/CVPR/MM/AAAI Associate Editor: IEEE TIP/IEEE TIFS/IEEE TAFFC Dr. Zheng Zhang is a faculty member at School of Computer Science and Technology, Harbin Institute of Technology, Shenzhen, China. He is an adjunct Professor at Shenzhen Loop Area Institute (SLAI, National AI Institute) and Peng Cheng Laboratory (PCL, National Lab), Shenzhen, China. He is leading the Sustainable Multimodal Learning (SMULL) Research Group, Harbin Institute of Technology, Shenzhen, and is the deputy director of the Shenzhen Key Laboratory of Visual Object Detection and Recognition, Shenzhen, China. Openings: I am continuously looking for highly motivated Ph.D. students and postdoctoral researchers to work on machine learning and multimedia. Please send me your CV if interested. I can supervise Ph.D. students affiliated with the Harbin Institute of Technology, SLAI, and PCL. For more detailed information, you are welcome to visit my SMULL Research Group. 招生：欢迎申请SMULL研究组2026年硕士/博士研究生！ Email: darrenzz219@gmail.com Office: Building L, HIT Campus, University Town of Shenzhen, Shenzhen 518055, China "Happiness depends upon ourselves." — Aristotle "Everything should be made as simple as possible, but not simpler." — Albert Einstein "Not everything that counts can be counted, and not everything that’s counted truly counts." — Albert Einstein Biography Dr. Zheng Zhang is a faculty member at the School of Computer Science and Technology, Harbin Institute of Technology, Shenzhen, China. Before this, he was an Assistant Researcher at The Hong Kong Polytechnic University (PolyU) and a Postdoctoral Research Fellow at The University of Queensland (UQ), supervised by Prof. Helen Huang. He was fortunately mentored by Prof. Heng Tao Shen and Prof. Ling Shao. He received his Ph.D. from Harbin Institute of Technology (HIT) in 2018, under the supervision of Prof. Yong Xu. During his Ph.D. study, he visited the Institute of Automation of Chinese Academy of Sciences between 2015 and 2016, advised by Prof. Cheng-Lin Liu. Dr. Zhang's research interests include Machine Learning and Multimedia, with particular emphasis on multimodal learning, resource-efficient deep learning, and AI security. He has published over 100 papers in leading international journals and conferences. He has received prestigious recognitions such as the Distinguished Ph.D. Dissertation Award from CIE (2019), Outstanding Young Research Achievement Award from CAAI (2019), Excellent Young Scientists Fund from Shenzhen (2023), and Pearl River Scholar Program of Guangdong Province (2023). His innovative multimedia systems have been featured by prominent media outlets, such as UN COP26, Xinhua News, and have been successfully transferred to leading industries like Tencent, Alibaba Group, Huawei, ICBC, and SZIDC. He has been recognized among the 'World’s Top 2% Scientists' for several consecutive years and is a Senior Member of IEEE and CCF. Dr. Zhang serves/served on the editorial boards of several prominent journals, including IEEE Trans. on Image Processing (IEEE TIP), IEEE Trans. on Information Forensics & Security (IEEE TIFS), IEEE Trans. on Affective Computing (IEEE TAFFC), and Elsevier journals. He has regularly contributed as an Area Chair for top-tier AI conferences, such as ICML, NeurIPS, ICLR, CVPR, AAAI, ACM MM, etc. Moreover, he has served on the organizing committees of several international conferences, including ADMA 2021 and 2023, ACM Multimedia Asia 2021, and other major events.
